text: I looked for a solution to this without success, I believe it's been raised on the ideas forum

I had this screen before on my modules.
You can solve this by clone your module.
Then you can see code on cloned module and you need to use cloned module on your templates.
Hi guys :slightly_smiling_face: Sorry for the delay, it was gone and then it’s coming back so I’m assuming there is actually a caching

Could do with some help on the Membership function... I can see how emails are sent out to invite existing contacts to register for access to protected content, but how do I create a page that will register new contacts who want to view it?
you can create any landing page and make the form tie into the list as part of your membership function.
<@UFB9AJJMA> :point_up::skin-tone-4:
Example: <https://www.sprockettalk.com/signup>

Ah thanks <@U25C65C3S>, I thought that would be the case but I can't actually test it until the client sets up a subdomain (P.S. free enterprise portals for agencies please :grin:)

So that's a form which adds a contact to a list via a workflow... which will trigger the password generation email?
Correct
(or notify of access if they already have been registered)
plus 1 for enterprise portal for agencies, but for this could you use the dev portal?
not for this template. the whole top part of the template was changed removing any instance of these input fields.
I'm not sure, will give it a test but I think it needs a proper domain (i.e. the docs say it won't work on default HubSpot domains)
Thank you very much sir
correct, the caching for this file is set low (30 mins). This may be a file that you want to have semrush ignore from the reporting.
what i was saying, an im sorry iuf it was clear. Im bad at that.
IS
that there is probably a flex column on the page
making it easy to change out modules on the edit view of the website
if that is the case then HubSpot will auto magically insert them into that flex column when you switch the template. EVEN if its 100% different template
Hi Jayme, you can also use <https://www.snapaddy.com/en/> they have a HubSpot Integration as well and great tools for that kind of purpose
That's true Chris. Happy to talk it through with you if you need to check the logic
Thanks <@UMXHBH6TC>. I’ll give that a try.
FYI. with <@U7SL518D6> help I was able to get this solved.  Turned out to be an issue with the version of Chrome I’m using.  Clearing the site data in my browser solved it.

Hello all. With the module Image gallery, I cannot hide arrows (at right and left of a slider). Impossible in css: the style `display: block` is in the button html tag. With jquery, it's impossible too (the display value cannot be changed). Maybe the javascript which add this style in the button display value is loaded after my js script. How do you change the `display` value for the arrows of a slider?
I believe that uses slick but it uses something else other than the common slick initialization.
let me look into this
Cool. Thanks.
Could use `visibility: hidden`.
I tried it, but I cannot remember why I didn't keep it...
or always resort to `display:none!important`
Thanks <@U22VBL87M> and <@U3T21PDBK>: the two methods works. <@U2H3TT8F2> it's okay. Forget it. Thanks all.
if you do want to go further, creating your own gallery module is also a possibility. that would give you complete control over the presentation and what controls are available.
Yes, but it's longer :wink:
those input fields that are still showing were not part of custom module that would have been added to a flex column. they were hardcoded
not as long as this took you :slightly_smiling_face:
